scenarioDescription:
The Oph 11 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Oph 11 is a star with 0.02 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Oph 11 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Oph 11 system


Oph 11 b

Oph 11 b was discovered by the Gemini Observatory observatory, in 2007-05, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 243.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Oph 11 b is 4452.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Oph 11 b is 12.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Oph 11 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system Oph 11, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Gemini Observatory.
name: Oph 11 - System With 1 Exoplanet
